A feature-length documentary film about hip-hop DJing, otherwise known as turntablism. From the South Bronx in the 1970s to San Francisco now, the world's best scratchers, beat-diggers, party-rockers, and producers wax poetic on beats, breaks, battles, and the infinite possibilities of viny

"Director Doug Pray (DJ Hype) pays tribute to the innovation art of DJing in the electrifying documentary Scratch. Featuring the most legendary hip-hop figures in the DJ scene, Pray's film is at once a deeply insightful historical document and a highly entertaining glimpse into the world of underground hip-hop. Modern luminaries such as DJ Shadow, Cut Chemist, Mix Master Mike (of the Beastie Boys), DJ Q-bert, Rob Swift, and DJ Swamp are interviewed alongside living legends like Afrika Bambaataa, Jazzy Jay, and Grand Master DXT, in order to paint a broad, comprehensive picture of how DJing has evolved over the years. Complete your DJ Shadow collection with this timeless DVD!"
